I am trying to build version 1.5.5 on Windows XP.  I am using cygwin 
exclusively for the build process (fortran and c).  I believe I have 
run configure correctly (I've turned off the flags related to Visual 
Studio).  I have Compaq Visual Fortan installed, but only cygwin for 
the C compilers.  

When I run 'make' I keep getting an error that the code is trying to 
run cl.exe and cannot find the file.  cl.exe is the Visual C 
compiler I think, which I don't have, or want to use.  

Can Cantera be built on Windows using just Cygwin?   

Here's the error:

building 'Cantera._cantera' extension
cl.exe /c /nologo /Ox /MD /W3 /GX /DNDEBUG -I../../build/include -
Isrc -I../clib/src -Ic:\PYTHON23\include -Ic:\PYTHON23
\PC /Tpsrc/pycantera.cpp /Fobuild\temp.win32-2.3
\Release\src/pycantera.obj
error: command 'cl.exe' failed: No such file or directory

Thanks,
David L.
